StoryText: I am taking an English test and this last question is really tough.
Question: Only one of the following sentences is grammatically correct, which one is it?

OptionText.Text: I have traveled further than you.
I have traveled further then you.
I have traveled farther than you.
I have traveled farther then you.

OptionResult.DiaryEntry: This sentence is wrong. 'Than' is correct but 'Further' is not correct in this case.

This choice is definitely wrong. 'Further' is wrong and so is 'Then'. Apparently, I was the only one in class to choose this answer and my teacher %FullName:NPC:1% makes me feel bad about it but :FullName:NPC:2% makes me feel better about it and tries to comfort me.

I chose correctly because 'Farther' is used when describing a distance and 'Than' is used when comparing. My teacher %FullName:NPC:1% is proud of me, especially since I was one of only two students to get this tough question right. Me and %FullName:NPC:2% and so we're both happy for one another.
This answer was wrong. I guess 'Farther' was right but 'Then' is wrong. In this scenario it should have been 'Than.' It was a tough one though, at least I was only wrong on portion of the question.
